extension.description: A property whose presence indicates its parent part is a required point of response for FedRAMP stakeholders.
extension.remarks:
This appears in FedRAMP profiles and resolved profile catalogs.  
For control statements, it signals to the CSP which statements require a response in the SSP.  
For control objectives, it signals to the assessor which control objectives must appear in the assessment results, which aligns with the FedRAMP test case workbook.

extension.description: Identifies the party who authored this revision.

remarks.p: On the revision element in the revision history, the party-uuid extension must match the UUID of an existing party in the metadata.

extension.description: The ISO/IEC-17020 identifier assigned to the assessor related to their status as an A2LA Accredited Third Party Assessment Organization.
Identifies a control that must be included in every FedRAMP assessment.
extension.remarks: Core controls must be assessed every year, and are often subject to additional scrutiny by assessors and adjudication reviewers.

extension.description: The overall electronic authentication (eAuth) level applied to the system.

enum.label: Level 1 (Low)
enum.#text: The overall eAuth Level is defined as Level 1 (Low).

enum.label: Level 2 (Moderate)
enum.#text: The overall eAuth Level is defined as Level 2 (Moderate).

enum.label: Level 3 (High)
enum.#text: The overall eAuth Level is defined as Level 3 (High).

extension.description: Identifies the FedRAMP authorization type.

enum.label: JAB P-ATO
enum.#text: A FedRAMP Joint Authorization Board (JAB) Provisional-Authorization to Operate (P-ATO).

enum.label: Agency ATO
enum.#text: A FedRAMP Agency Authorization to Operate (ATO).

enum.label: Tailored (LI-SaaS) ATO
enum.#text: A FedRAMP Tailored authorization to operate (ATO) for low impact Software as a Service (LI-SaaS) systems.

extension.description: The current number of users internal to the organization.
The current number of users external to the organization.
The anticipated number of users internal to the organization in one year.
The anticipated number of users external to the organization in one year.
Indicates whether this system is privacy sensitive.

enum.label: Yes
enum.#text: Privacy Sensitive

enum.label: No
enum.#text: Not Privacy Sensitive

extension.description: Does the ISA collect, maintain, or share PII in any identifiable form?

enum.label: Yes
enum.#text: Yes, the ISA collects, maintains, or shares some form of PII.

enum.label: No
enum.#text: No, the ISA does not collect, maintain, or share PII in any form.

extension.description: Does the ISA collect, maintain, or share PII from or about the public?

enum.label: Yes
enum.#text: Yes, the ISA collects, maintains, or shares PII from or about the public.

enum.label: No
enum.#text: No, the ISA does not collect, maintain, or share PII from or about the public.

extension.description: Has a Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) ever been performed for the ISA?

enum.label: Yes
enum.#text: Yes, a PIA has been performed.

enum.label: No
enum.#text: No, a PIA has not been performed..

extension.description: Is there a Privacy Act System of Records Notice (SORN) for this ISA system?

enum.label: Yes
enum.#text: Yes, there is a SORN ID for this system.

enum.label: No
enum.#text: No, there is not a SORN ID for this system.

extension.description: An assigned System of Records Notice (SORN) identifier for this system.
Defines the sensitivity level of the identified user type.

enum.label: High Risk
enum.#text: Misuse of the user's access could result in grave damage to the public's trust.

enum.label: Severe
enum.#text: Misuse of the user's access could result in a substantial degree of harm or serious damage to the public’s trust.

enum.label: Moderate
enum.#text: Misuse of the user's access could result in a fair amount of harm or serious damage to the public’s trust.

enum.label: Limited
enum.#text: Misuse of the user's access could result in some harm or discernible damage to the public’s trust.

enum.label: Not Applicable
enum.#text: The user does not have access to the system.

extension.remarks:
Values are as required by FedRAMP for packages based on NIST 800-53, Revision 4.  
Authoritative source: [OPM Position Designation (Page 18)](#871713A8-5A27-4AC3-8B94-972588469C6B).

extension.description: Name of the interconnection service processor.
Describes the information transmitted over the interconnection.
Identifies the type of asset.

enum.#text: Operating System
Database
Service
Policy
Process
Procedure
Private Branch Exchange
Firewall
Router
Switch
Storage Array

extension.description: Identifies the direction of information flow for the interconnection.

enum.#text: Incoming
Outgoing
Bi-Directional

extension.description: Identifies the type of security applied to the interconnection.

enum.#text: IPsec
Virtual Private Network
Secure Socket Layer
Certificate
Secure File Transfer
Other

extension.formal-name: Different states of inventory items: public, private, et cetera.
extension.description: Indicates if the asset is virtual.

enum.#text: Yes
No

extension.remarks:
Deprecated.  
Use core OSCAL "public" and "virtual" `prop` instead.

extension.description: A circuit used for the communication.
Identifies the mechanisms/protocol(s) used to secure the communication.

enum.label: IPsec
enum.#text: IPsec

enum.label: VPN
enum.#text: Virtual Private Network

enum.label: SSL
enum.#text: Secure Socket Layer

enum.label: Cert
enum.#text: Certificate

enum.label: SFT
enum.#text: Secure File Transfer

enum.label: Other
enum.#text: Other

extension.description: Identifies what uses the service.
Identifies the type(s) of scans to be performed on this inventory-item or component.

enum.label: Infrastructure
enum.#text: The component or inventory item is included in operating system (OS) and/or infrastructure scans.

enum.label: Database
enum.#text: The component or inventory item is included in Database scans.

enum.label: Web
enum.#text: The component or inventory item is included in Web interface/application scans.

enum.label: Other
enum.#text: The component or inventory item is included in non-typical scans.

extension.description: Provides the date the control expects to be implemented. Must be present when Implementation Status is "Planned"
Indicates whether the assessor recommends the system be authorized by the authorizing official.

enum.label: Yes
enum.#text: Yes, the assessor recommends the system for authorization.

enum.label: No
enum.#text: No, the assessor does not recommend the system for authorization.

extension.description: The short name for the system represented in the resource.
The FedRAMP-assigned identifier for this system.
The baseline/profile for this system based on its FIPS-199 categorization.
The date the system was authorized. Omit or leave blank for an initial authorization.
Explains the system's purpose.
A brief description of the system.
Indicates whether a sampling methodology was used instead of assessing the entire system.

enum.label: Yes
enum.#text: Yes, a sampling methodology was used.

enum.label: No
enum.#text: No, a sampling methodology was not used.

extension.description: Indicates the implementation status of the control objective.

enum.label: Implemented
enum.#text: The assessor finds sufficient evidence to agree the control objective is fully implemented.

enum.label: Partial
enum.#text: The assessor finds evidence to suggest a portion of the control objective is implemented and a portion is not.

enum.label: Planned
enum.#text: The assessor finds this control objective is not implemented, but there is evidence the system owner has a plan for implementing it.

enum.label: Alternative Implementation
enum.#text: The assessor finds evidence of an alternative implementation, which the assessor judges to provide protection similar enough to satisfy this control.

enum.label: Not Applicable (N/A)
enum.#text: The assessor finds this control objective does not apply to this system.

extension.description: Indicates the implementation status of the control.

enum.label: Implemented
enum.#text: The assessor finds sufficient evidence to agree the control objective is fully implemented.

enum.label: Partial
enum.#text: The assessor finds evidence to suggest a portion of the control objective is implemented and a portion is not.

enum.label: Planned
enum.#text: The assessor finds this control objective is not implemented, but there is evidence the system owner has a plan for implementing it.

enum.label: Alternative Implementation
enum.#text: The assessor finds evidence of an alternative implementation, which the assessor judges to provide protection similar enough to satisfy this control.

enum.label: Not Applicable (N/A)
enum.#text: The assessor finds this control objective does not apply to this system.

extension.description: Indicates a leveraged authorization used for this control.
extension.remarks: This is for legacy SSP conversion to OSCAL. The preferred approach is to specify the leveraged system as a `component` and reference it in the control using `by-component`.

extension.description: The point(s) from which the control satisfaction originates.

constraint.remarks: When an prop is defined as an extension, a separate constraint assembly is needed to specify data type and allowed values on the @`value` flag.

enum.#text: Service Provider (Corporate)
Service Provider (System Specific)
Configured by Customer
Provided by Customer
Inherited

extension.description: The abbreviated name for the system, such as an acronym.
The FedRAMP-assigned system identifier.
Identifies the relevant OSCAL baseline.
extension.remarks: As with all URIs in OSCAL, this may contain a URI fragment, which identifies the local resource containing the relevant profile.

extension.description: The FedRAMP-assigned system identifier.
The date of the system's initial FedRAMP authorization.
The login URL for a web application.
The login ID used to assess the web application.
Indicates the type of test represented by the task.

enum.label: Web Application
enum.#text: This task tests a web application.

extension.description: Cites the SSP defined user role to use for testing.
A CSP-assigned POA&M identifier.
A control impacted by this POA&M item.
extension.remarks:
Impacted control is required in the POA&M and optional in the SAR.  
It is allowed in the SAR in anticipation of duplicating open risks from the SAR to the POA&M.

extension.description: Assessor's recommended risk priority. Lower numbers are higher priority. One (1) is highest priority.
Indicates the assessor's recommendation for initial or continued authorization.

enum.label: Yes
enum.#text: The assessor recommends initial or continued authorization.

enum.label: No
enum.#text: The assessor does not recommend initial or continued authorization.

extension.description: The likelihood of a risk.

enum.#text: Low
Moderate
High

extension.description: A tool assigned vulnerability ID.
A tool assigned Plugin ID.
The risk cannot be remediated without impact to the system and must be accepted.

enum.label: Investigating
enum.#text: A possible operational requirement is being investigated.

enum.label: Tracking
enum.#text: An operational requirement deviation request was submitted to the AO and is pending adjudication.

enum.label: Approved
enum.#text: The operational requirement has been approved by the AO.

enum.label: Withdrawn
enum.#text: The operational requirement was withdrawn.

extension.description: The risk was found to be a false positive report.

enum.label: Investigating
enum.#text: A possible risk adjustment is being investigated.

enum.label: Tracking
enum.#text: A false positive deviation request was submitted to the AO and is pending adjudication.

enum.label: Approved
enum.#text: The false positive has been approved by the AO.

enum.label: Withdrawn
enum.#text: The false positive was withdrawn.

extension.description: Mitigating factors were identified or implemented, reducing the likelihood or impact of the risk.

enum.label: Investigating
enum.#text: A possible risk adjustment is being investigated.

enum.label: Tracking
enum.#text: A risk adjustment deviation request was submitted to the AO and is pending adjudication.

enum.label: Approved
enum.#text: The risk adjustment has been approved by the AO.

enum.label: Withdrawn
enum.#text: The risk adjustment was withdrawn.

extension.description: A vendor resolution is pending, but not yet available.

enum.label: Investigating
enum.#text: The risk is a suspected vendor dependency, and is being investigated for verification.

enum.label: Tracking
enum.#text: The vendor has confirmed the issue and is working on a resolution.

enum.label: Resolved
enum.#text: The vendor released the fix and it has been applied.

enum.label: Withdrawn
enum.#text: The vendor dependency was withdrawn.

extension.description: The type of assessment (e.g., initial authorization, annual assessment, assessment for a significant change, or another type of assessment).

The authentication method(s) for users of a leveraged service or external interconnection. Refer to for authentication methods NIST 800-63B (https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html) for authentiction methods
The users or roles that can access the leveraged service or external interconnection.
The cryptographic module is used for data at rest (DAT) or data in transit (DIT).
The CSP ensured the independent assessor team roles are appropriately filled.
Any discrepancies between inventory that was in scope for the planned assessment and the assets in the assessment results.
The justification or reason for any discrepancies between inventory that was in scope for the planned assessment and the assets in the assessment results.
The date when security control implementations for the appropriate control baseline was completed.
extension.remarks:
Added for rev 5 templates.  
“Fully operational” means there are no “gaps” in the security control baseline implementations for the system. The CSP attests that the security controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting established security requirements.

extension.description: Confirmation that the independent assessor performed a manual review of (scan) configuration files to analyze for existing vulnerabilities.
The independent assessor ensured the assessment team roles are appropriately filled.
The impact level of a leveraged authorization.
Any (security) compliance certifications the third party external service has (e.g., PCI SOC 2, CSA STAR Level 2, etc.).
The security impact level of the data (Low, Moderate, High), processed by or stored in the external service, in accordance with FIPS 199 & NIST 800-60 Vol. 2.
The type of data / information processed by or stored in the external service, in accordance with NIST 800-60 Vol. 2.
A description of the hosting environment (e.g., corporate network, IaaS, or self-hosted) for the external service.

A description of the potential risks introduced by the external system/service and impact to the CSO or federal data if the confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of the system/service is compromised.
Numeric indicator of the type of interconnection, where 1 = Non-FedRAMP Authorized Cloud Services, 2 = Corporate Shared Services, and 3 = Update Services for In-Boundary Software/Services.
The IP address of a component, inventory item, or other asset.
extension.remarks:
Added for rev 5 templates.  
Core OSCAL has an "ipv4-address" `prop` which can be used for certain component types and for inventory items.  This extension can be used instead, and is also applicable for other assemblies such as `assessment-platform`.

extension.description: The subnet for a component of inventory item.
Indicates if this vulnerability is on the CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.
extension.remarks:
Added for rev 5 templates.  
In accordance with Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 22-01, CSPs must track their vulnerabilities against the KEV catalog.

extension.description: The KEV catalog specified due date by which the vulnerability must be remediated.
extension.remarks:
Added for rev 5 templates.  
In accordance with Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 22-01, CSPs must track their vulnerabilities against the KEV catalog.

extension.description: The test ID for the manual test method.
The identifier corresponding to the FedRAMP package ID.
The product or tool name for a component or inventory item.

Any type of agreement between a CSP and the leveraged CSP vendors who support products (e.g., End User Licensing Agreement (EULA), Service-Level Agreement (SLA), App License Agreement, Contract, etc.).
The back-matter resource reference used to determine which FedRAMP validation rulesets apply.
The scan coverage
The general quantity of significant change(s) in scope.
Identifier for sort ordering content.
extension.remarks: Core OSCAL has a "sort-id" `prop`, however this "sort-id" extension can be applied to any assembly that provided information which may need to be rendered in a specific order.  The `step` assembly is an example of this.

extension.description: Specify if the product / component is still supported by the vendor / manufacturer.
The "type" of back-matter resource.
extension.remarks:
Added for rev 5 templates.  
Locally defined resource types.

extension.description: The vendor or manufacturer of a component or inventory item.
